{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3488064,"name":"Berk","username":"BerkSadyam","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T13:43:48.110Z","cooked":"

So I am new to swerve module programming and while I try to code for the swerve module my mind created a thought.Insted of writing 4 different swerve module code why don’t we write one and make the other modules follow the one that we have control on.Will it create any problems?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T14:45:54.115Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":89.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482731,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-programi-ng-wi-th-leader-follower-commands","display_username":"Berk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71572,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-programi-ng-wi-th-leader-follower-commands/482731/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3488068,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T13:59:58.412Z","cooked":"

Let’s think through this as a thought experiment.

Imagining a single swerve module, what range of motion does it have? How can it move?

Now add in the other 3 all doing the exact same thing. What range of motion will the robot as a whole have? How can it move?

Is there any movement directions (linear or rotation) that would be impossible with this configuration? What would the modules each need to be doing differently to allow for the missing movements?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T13:59:58.412Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":29.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482731,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-programi-ng-wi-th-leader-follower-commands","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-programi-ng-wi-th-leader-follower-commands/482731/2","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3488071,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T14:04:53.092Z","cooked":"

This may help. Math ranges from 9th to 12th grade.
BeginningSwerveCalculations.pdf (715.6 KB)
You are right that the four swerve modules are almost the same but that little difference in where they are placed in space is what makes them work independently.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T14:05:43.073Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":114,"readers_count":113,"score":22.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482731,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-programi-ng-wi-th-leader-follower-commands","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"/uploads/short-url/tkLA7j2G1EnOGJ14Xp8NO1XAP5V.pdf","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-programi-ng-wi-th-leader-follower-commands/482731/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3488093,"name":"Jade","username":"spacey_sooty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/spacey_sooty/{size}/256378_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T14:45:24.304Z","cooked":"

This doesn’t work cause of how swerve kinematics end up. If you want to just move across the x and y plane this works fine the issue is when you want to spin. In order to optimally spin your robot each module needs to be facing at a different angle, which means they can’t all be controlled the same way

This is actually very interesting. As others have said, it would not work as swerve, but what you are basically describing is a sort of software linked Crab Drive. Essentially this but with software instead of the chain.

four:

Crab Drive

Yes it is and that brings back memories that we were trying to block. We didn’t like crab drive but we couldn’t afford swerve several years ago and wanted to try to up our game.

Swerve software can perform some pretty wild moves if you move the center of rotation from the center of the robot. It can also be programmed to regress to arcade or tank drive.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T19:06:30.498Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":66,"readers_count":65,"score":13.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482731,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-programi-ng-wi-th-leader-follower-commands","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-programi-ng-wi-th-leader-follower-commands/482731/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3488750,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T04:09:51.034Z","cooked":"
BerkSadyam:

writing 4 different swerve module code

Computers are good at following a set of instructions in different contexts. Pretty much any code you download (do not try to write your own from scratch during build season) is going to use this trick so someone only wrote code for A module – and has the computer run the same code for each of the modules.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T04:09:51.034Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":48,"readers_count":47,"score":9.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482731,"topic_slug":"swerve-module-programi-ng-wi-th-leader-follower-commands","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/swerve-module-programi-ng-wi-th-leader-follower-commands/482731/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3488754,"name":"","username":"AvocadoPeel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/avocadopeel/{size}/232401_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T04:22:44.152Z","cooked":"

even if your goal was making an equivalent to crab drive, setting the motor controllers to follow a master only makes them match the output voltage, not PID to the same setpoint, so I’d expect the motors to drift out of sync over time. Probably best to stick with the common solution of making a module class with 4 instances.
